action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant in the cupboard, the orange on the table and the book on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a pantry now. There are a refrigerator and a freezer. The refrigerator is closed. The freezer is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a sandwich, a orange, a peach, a apple and a banana.
You take the orange. In your inventory you have a orange.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room and a pantry here.
The cupboard is now open. The cupboard is empty.
You put the orange on the counter.

You are in a pantry now. There are a sandwich, a apple, a refrigerator, a freezer, a peach and a banana. The sandwich is in the refrigerator. The apple is in the refrigerator. The refrigerator is open. The freezer is closed. The peach is in the refrigerator. The banana is in the refrigerator. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
You take the sandwich. In your inventory you have a sandwich.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate, a orange and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The orange is on the counter. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a living room and a pantry here.
You put the sandwich in the cupboard.

> put orange on table 
(I assume table is the same as counter)
You can't see a table here.
You put the orange on the counter.

> put sandwich on shelf 
(I assume shelf is the same as the empty space where the book will go)
You can't see a shelf here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
There is a sandwich in the cupboard. The cupboard is openable and currently open.
You can't see a shelf here.

You are in a pantry now. There are a apple, a refrigerator, a freezer, a peach and a banana. The apple is in the refrigerator. The refrigerator is open. The freezer is closed. The peach is in the refrigerator. The banana is in the refrigerator. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
You can't see a potted plant here.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate, a orange and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The orange is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room and a pantry here.

> take potted plant 
(I assume it's in the kitchen)
You can't see a potted plant here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a table, a chair and a side table. There are passages to a hallway and a kitchen here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a living room, a broom closet and a bedroom here.
You take the potted plant. In your inventory you have a potted plant.
You can't go to a kitchen from here.
You can't go to a pantry from here.
You are in a living room now. There are a couch, a table, a chair and a side table. There are passages to a hallway and a kitchen here.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate, a orange and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The orange is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room and a pantry here.
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a sandwich.
You put the potted plant in the cupboard.

> put orange on table 
(I assume table is the same as counter)
You can't see a table here.
You put the orange on the counter.

> put sandwich on shelf 
(I assume shelf is the same as the empty space where the book will go)
You can't see a shelf here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
There are a sandwich and a pottedplant in the cupboard. The cupboard is openable and currently open.

> put sandwich on shelf 
(I assume shelf is the same as the empty space where the book will go)
You can't see a shelf here.

You are in a pantry now. There are a apple, a refrigerator, a freezer, a peach and a banana. The apple is in the refrigerator. The refrigerator is open. The freezer is closed. The peach is in the refrigerator. The banana is in the refrigerator. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
You can't see a book here.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate, a orange and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The orange is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room and a pantry here.

You are in a pantry now. There are a apple, a refrigerator, a freezer, a peach and a banana. The apple is in the refrigerator. The refrigerator is open. The freezer is closed. The peach is in the refrigerator. The banana is in the refrigerator. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
You can't see a cupboard here.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate, a orange and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The orange is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room and a pantry here.
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there are a sandwich and a potted plant.

> take book 
(I assume it's in the cupboard)
You can't see a book here.

> take sandwich 
(I assume it's in the cupboard)
You take the sandwich. In your inventory you have a sandwich.

> put sandwich on shelf 
(I assume shelf is the same as the empty space where the book will go)
You can't see a shelf here.
